content.description: For the graph of the function f, the x axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The graph is a line passing through (negative 5 comma negative 5), the origin, and (5 comma 5). For the graph of the function g, the x axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The graph is a line passing through (negative 5 comma 5), the origin, and (5 comma negative 5).
content.question: For the graph of the function h, the x axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The graph is a horizontal line with a y value of 1. For the graph of the function k, the x axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1. The graph is a horizontal line with a y value of 0. ​The function <math alttext="p"><semantics><mi>p</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> (not shown) is a polynomial function of degree <math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The graphs of four functions <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="h"><semantics><mi>h</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are given. The output values of <math alttext="p"><semantics><mi>p</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are the same as the output values of the composition function when <math alttext="p"><semantics><mi>p</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is composed with one of these functions as the input function. For which of the functions is this statement true?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
